subject: Using enum class instead of string in more places
commitMessage:
Using enum class instead of string in more places

ReportingType and ReportUpdates are now used as enum class in more
places than before. Changed how this two fields are stored in
persistent configuration. Increased Report::Version to break backward
compatibility. Updated unit tests to verify changed functionality.

Tested:
- All existing tests are passing

Change-Id: I55db205aefbe2b5a69fb7a31ccf11885aaecaaf2
Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Grobelny <krzysztof.grobelny@intel.com>

Change has been successfully merged by Krzysztof Grobelny

Are these interfaces now redundant and to be removed? Same change made in Triggers produced new interface 'TriggerActions' and removed interfaces 'LogToJournal', 'LogToRedfish', 'UpdateReport'. IMO we should have a consistent approach in Reports and Triggers at this point.
I guess that it is still here to not break compatibility, and can be safely removed in the future.
Yes, It has to be here to ensure backward compatibility. Once new API is approved in bmcweb we will be able to remove it.
So keeping this one open, please decide if you want to resolve it now or only when the obsolete interfaces are removed.
It is impossible to remove it now. It will be removed in future patch after new API is integrated.
